result.execSummary:
The defendant Julio Cesar Alicea III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid in full during the term of probation.    If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julio Cesar Alicea III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: to amend JOC to correct enhancer.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion. State moved to amend Count 1 to misd. Poss THC 1st,  as a repeater. Granted. Defense waived filing of an amended complaint.  Plead  no contest. Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the count he is pleading to.  He understood. Court confirmed prior conviction.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of amended count 1.   Joint recommendation for  probation.   DNA sample and surcharge.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  AODA.  o/m employment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 1  year probation.  Concurrent with any probation now serving.  DNA sample and surcharge.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  AODA if agent recommends.  Obtain and maintain employment.   Not to terminate with agent prior approval.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. CC. Pay in full during term of probation.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Set for plea/sentencing 1/11/16 at 10:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 11-25-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 12-14-2015 03:00 pm.

court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  He understood.  Court found that the defendant freely and voluntarily waived his time limits for holding the preliminary hearing.  PTC 11/25 STC 12/14.  Track traffic citation.  NGP entered on those. Bond continued.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Reading of complaint waived.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Court advised defendant to contact an attorney.  He understood.  AIA set for 11/2/15 at 9:30 am. Bond set.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
